item.title: SIO2Pi = Atari 800 + Raspberry Pi
item.description: TL;DR: The first computer I programmed was an Atari 800. I'm using a Raspberry Pi Zero W and a simple serial voltage conversion circuit to load disk images from the internet onto my Atari 800.

item.title: I Made a WiFi Pumpkin
item.description: TL;DR: I made a wifi pumpkin using an ESP8266 with LED matrix eyes and mouth. I added a web-based remote control for my phone using websockets. It was fun!

item.title: Upgrading my Couch PC monitor, v1.2
item.description: TL;DR: My DIY couch PC monitor has been upgraded for a third time.

item.title: Making of the GameChord
item.description: TL;DR: I made a USB keypad that's good for gaming and typing entirely with one hand.

item.title: Building a USB controller for an IBM Model M
item.description: TL;DR: I wired up a Teensy 2.0++ to an IBM Model M keyboard, which gave it a USB interface and custom firmware that can remap keys and do other interesting things.

item.title: Keyboard hacking seems like fun
item.description: TL;DR: I think I've caught the DIY keyboard hacking bug, and I'll probably end up building something weird.

item.title: Building my couch computing station
item.description: Remember when I posted about gaming from the Orchard House couch? The key part was figuring out how to get a laptop-quality LCD monitor working in the living room, preferably attached to my trusty IKEA DAVE. Well, despite my best attempts at ruining my materials and tools, I managed to get it built!

item.title: Gaming from the Orchard House couch
item.description: I like playing video games; it’s one of my favorite things in life. I also like hanging out with my wife; she’s my favorite person in the world. This is a post about ensuring these two things can happen together. This is also a post where I played with SketchUp for the first time.
